thread.title: Homeless man flooded with job offers after giving handwritten CV to stranger
thread.title_full: Homeless man flooded with job offers after giving handwritten CV to stranger

title: Homeless man flooded with job offers after giving handwritten CV to stranger
text:
Tip : Use comma (,) to separate multiple quotes. Learn more... 
Thu, Jul 16, 2015, 18:44 BST - UK Markets closed Homeless man flooded with job offers after giving handwritten CV to stranger By Elizabeth Anderson | Telegraph – 18 minutes ago 27.32 0.00 
The 20-year-old man from Liverpool could now enjoy a life off the streets, after his plea for a job went viral 
A desperate homeless man who gave a handwritten CV to a stranger looks set to land a job after the note went viral on social media. 
Jordan Lockett, 20, stopped passerby Aaron O'Dwyer in the street and asked for help because he was "sick of wasting away". 
Mr O'Dwyer shared the note on Twitter (Xetra: A1W6XZ - news ) and his photograph has been retweeted more than 2,500 times since Tuesday, as well-wishers offered their support. 
= The letter reads: = 
= Need work. Need help. Seriously lost. = 
= I'm sick of wasting away now. = 
= I'm always being told to go to homeless centres but they're not helping. = 
= I think it's because they need a job for one and because I'm young and fit and no dependencies I'm on the bottom of the priority list but this is killing my mental health. = 
= I write my CV likes this because I don't have anything to put it on. = 
= I worked as a motorbike mechanic for 2 years but that was from the start of year 9 to the end of high school on a course and my boss stopped picking me up 2ish week before I was supposed to finish and left me with no grades or experience proof. = 
= Very fast learner and hard worker. = 
= Can I afford not to be? = 
= Any chances? = 
On Wednesday, Mr O'Dwyer tweeted that Mr Lockett had been found, and he had meetings set up with people offering him work. 
He tweeted: "Just been told that Jordan has been found and off the streets an he's meeting people tomorrow about some work, job done, nice one twitter" 
Mr O'Dwyer, 18, from Liverpool, said he just wanted to help. 
"I was walking around Bold Street and I saw him sat at the side of the road. I saw he was homeless, he didn’t look much older than me so I gave him £5 and he insisted I took his CV," he told the Metro (Other OTC: MTRAF - news ) .
